intro: Mercurialis nemoralis, commonly known as the common mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant has distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which can be irritating to the skin. The plant is sometimes considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
